The bottom line is that this anime is kick-butt and you should definitely watch it if you like action, humor, adventure, and a GREAT plot with GREAT characters! I don't care who you are.

The story and and its characters are probably the strongest aspects of One Piece. Each ark portrays the situation very clearly, and foreshadows some future problems without being forced in. Throughout One Piece, it talks about many things like friendship, family, segregation, the abuse of power, and freedom. And, it never gets boring... other than some fillers and the first part of 300s. While some people may argue that this anime has been going on for so long that it has gotten boring, it has not. Every single part has something completely new while integrating the past to develop the story... something many stories lack.

For series of this length, thereâ€™s a fairly intriguing piece of conjecture that I occasionally enjoy trotting around. According to the theory, no matter how awesome the original premise, no matter how charming the cast of characters, no matter how competent the studio, every long series will tank after about 75 episodes. As evidence, a myriad of lengthy anime can be cited that begin excellently and then slowly degenerate into recycled material and filler. Kenshin was excellent until some genius decided to deviate from the manga. Kodomo no Omocha was brilliant until the series drowned itself in the utterly craptastic New York arc. Naruto was actually fairly fun until Gaara and his whiny, sniveling flashbacks slowed the series down to a monotonous crawl. Prince of Tennis, Slam Dunk, Galaxy Angel... I could rant on this phenomenon for hours, and probably will someday.

[1m[22m
With One Piece, however, the feeling is crucially different. While watching the anime, one gets the impression that Eiichiro Oda, the author of the original manga, was focused not on money, but something much more substantial: having fun. Every element of the storyline, from the delightfully absurd jokes to the most serious of plot points, seems to be there because the manga creator enjoyed putting them there. This, I believe, is the reason why One Piece has remained fresh for so long. For some unfathomable reason, the creator enjoys pumping out volume after volume of golden material. Furthermore, as opposed to many other manga to anime conversions, the studio is actually faithful with its material. The result is a storyline that, despite some inevitable inconsistency, is one of the best of its kind: an unnaturally enjoyable romp across the seas of a thoroughly original world.

Animation, while fairly nice, is not completely free of the penny-pinching shortcuts that typically plague shows of this length. Backgrounds are often rather ugly and hastily drawn, and anything drawn at a distance tends to be a little too oversimplified. The show also sports some truly ugly character designs that take a good deal of time to get used to, and a good deal longer to actually appreciate.

One piece is a very enjoyable adventure story with some really good characters and cool fights. Most people like one piece mainly because of this and because it has been good since it started. It never leaves you bored or disappointed. Even only for this it is good enough to call it one of the best anime of all time. But if you are looking for more than just that, if you need something more, i am sure you will find even more than you would expect. I am not saying that meaning is only good thing in things and thing can't be good if they don't have meaning in them, i believe art can have 0 meaning and still be amazing or can be ugly but have so much meaning that it still makes great art. I think One Piece is in perfect balance of how it looks and what meanings it has behind those looks. It kinda reminds me of The Matrix with that (great action movie and great meaning and philosophy behind it).

The story of One Piece may be the best part of it. IT's long but not really drawn out. The story writing is so good that some 1 episode flashbacks can be as good and even better than whole great movies. For example one of flashback stories really reminded me of a great movie Life is beautiful and i even felt like this was better written. Eiichiro Oda created a whole world to explore together with great characters. And there are some things Oda obviously planed and wrote years before we saw it on anime and when we did it left mind-blown. And there are more thing waiting to be revealed in future too. It's a story about everything. Story about birth, death, being a parent, about brotherhood, about sacrifice, about loss, about friendship, about war, about peace, about freedom, about dreams, about life and existence itself and SO MUCH MORE there is no way you can count a all of it down. And it never get too annoying with one thing. It never gives you too much of anything that can make you bored.

One piece changes your life. It changes you but it never gives you straight teaching how you should be or not be. One Piece just makes you feel what characters feels and after that its up to you, its your own decision if you want to or what you will learn something from that feeling. There are just so many kinds of great characters and they just do their things and you relate to it. It never is like marines are good and pirates are bad, or pirates are good and marines are bad, there are good and bad people on both sides. Yes our main heroes are pirates but they never say pirates are all good, we see some pirates killing innocent people and marines who don't care about people. Characters never stand there and say something like: 'oh i am a good person and you should be too'. What you learn from One Piece comes itself. You watch characters, they go through something, that changes them and One Piece makes you feel like you are going through the same thing with them and it comes to you more like experience than as a lesson. You feel it and you get it. It never tells you what is right and what is wrong or what is good and what is bad.

In conclusion i would like to say that One Piece is not one of the best anime but also one of the best masterpieces of art ever created (and it's not even near finishing yet and i can already say so). It is very true that One Piece is probably one of the most over-hyped anime out at the moment, but it is for great reason. Unlike Naruto and Bleach, One Piece is a gem in the Shounen genre. As just about every shounen that has surfaced in the past decade, it is heavily inspired by Dragon Ball, but I feel that it's major success here is that instead of focusing on 30 episode fights, it develops the story incredibly well. One Piece has a surprisingly funny surface, with tons of great gags and character quirks that are impossible not to love. The incredible thing about One Piece's characters is that all of them actually get a back story. And believe it or not, majority of these background stories are incredible and tear jerking.

Which brings me to my next point, the characters. Oda has succeeded in making the most unique cast of characters for a Shounen anime. I mean, we do have our major shounen goals like 'I want to get stronger' as a plot device used often, but you fall for these characters and you actually want to see them grow stronger. At first we're used to seeing Luffy succeed time after time, but strength slowly starts to catch up to them and we get to see them way over their heads and finally reach an obstacle they can't over come and hit absolute rock bottom. Which is rare for an anime of this breed.

I think this brings me to the downsides of One Piece. One Piece unfortunetly is plagued with incredibly slow pacing at times. It seems like there will be an incredible arc, and then an okay one that seems to just drag on and on (looking at you Thriller Bark). There will be times were it just seems half of the stuff shown could of been summed up into half as many episodes. Fillers are also a downfall. For an anime of this length, it's bound to happen of course. And fortunetly the fillers aren't horribly long or awful, for the most part.

In closing, I think One Piece is an extremely intriguing anime that definitely deserves at least an attempt at watching. Don't let the length scare you away. This isn't a show struggling to maintain a plot as it goes. One Piece has incredible substance. It's a journey around the world and it feels as large scale as it should.
